questions.question: ………………………….. his best efforts, he could not pass the test.
questions.description: Despite is a preposition. It is used before a noun or noun phrase.

questions.question: She is not very beautiful …………………………, you cannot help liking her.
questions.description: However is a transitional adverb. In meaning it is similar to but, but it is not a conjunction.

questions.question: …………………………….. she was there, she refused to talk to me.
questions.description: Though is used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: I went to his home …………………………. I could not meet him.
questions.description: Use a full stop or a semicolon before however.

questions.question: ……………………………. she was the most deserving candidate, she didn’t get the job.
questions.description: Though is a conjunction it is followed by a clause.

questions.question: …………………………….. her strange accent, I could understand her.
She works three jobs …………………………….., she does not earn enough to make a living.
………………………………. she is younger than me, she is the wiser of us two.
………………………………. their best efforts, they could not save her.
questions.description: Despite and in spite of mean the same.

questions.question: ……………………………. hard you try, you will not be able to win.
questions.description: However hard means not matter how hard.

questions.question: ……………………………. they played to the best of their abilities, they could not win the match.
Strange …………………………… it might sound, I don’t enjoy music.
questions.description: Strange through it might sound means the same as though it might sound strange.
